TEXT.English: [TAB]The potato (Solanum tuberosum) is a perennial plant of the Solanaceae, or nightshade, family, commonly grown for its starchy tuber. Potatoes are the world's most widely grown tuber crop, and the fourth largest crop in terms of fresh produce (after rice, wheat, and maize), but this ranking is inflated due to the high water content of fresh potatoes relative to that of other crops. The potato originated in South America, somewhere in present-day Peru. Potatoes are important to the culture of the Andes, where farmers grow many different varieties that have a remarkable diversity of colors and shapes. Potatoes spread to the rest of the world after European contact with the Americas in the late 1400s and early 1500s and have since become an important field crop.
TEXT.French: La pomme de terre (Solanum tuberosum) est une plante perpétuelle du Solanaceae, ou la belladone, la famille, ordinairement grandi pour son tubercule amylacé. Les pommes de terre sont la récolte de tubercule du monde le plus largement grandie, et la quatrième plus grande récolte dans les termes de frais produit (après le riz, le blé, et le maïs), mais ce classer est gonflé en raison de l'haut contenu d'eau de pommes de terre fraîches relatives à cela d'autres récoltes. La pomme de terre a provenu dans Amérique du sud, quelque part dans Pérou actuel. Les pommes de terre sont importantes à la culture des Andes, où les fermiers grandissent beaucoup de variétés différentes qui a une diversité remarquable de couleurs et de formes. Les pommes de terre étalent au reste du monde après le contact européen avec les Amériques dans les 1400 derniers et les 1500 premiers et ont puisque deviennent une récolte de champ importante.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Kartoffel (Solanum tuberosum) ist eine anhaltende Pflanze des Solanaceae, oder Nachtschatten, Familie, normalerweise gewachsen für seinen stärkehaltigen tuber. Kartoffeln sind der Welt die meiste allgemein gewachsene tuber Ernte, und das vierte die größte Ernte in Begriffen frischen Bodenprodukts (nach Reis, Weizen, und Mais), aber diese Rangzuordnung ist auf Grund des hohen Wassergehalts der Verwandte von frischen Kartoffeln zu das von anderen Ernten hochgetrieben. Die Kartoffel hat in Südamerika, irgendwo in zeitgemäßem Peru hervorgebracht. Kartoffeln sind wichtig für die Kultur von den Anden, wo Landwirte viele verschiedene Vielfalt wachsen, die eine bemerkenswerte Verschiedenheit von Farben und Gestalten haben. Kartoffeln breiten zur restlichen Welt aus nachdem europäischer Kontakt mit den Amerikas in den späten 1400er Jahren und den frühen 1500er Jahren und haben, da eine wichtige Feldernte wird.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La patata (il tuberosum di Solanum) è una pianta perenne del Solanaceae, o la morella, la famiglia, comunemente cresciuto per il suo tubero ricco di amido. Le patate sono il mondo la maggior parte del raccolto di tubero molto cresciuto, ed il quarto il più grande raccolto in termini di prodotto fresco (dopo il riso, dopo il frumento, e dopo il granturco), ma questo classificare è gonfiato dovuto all'alto contenuto dell'acqua di patate fresche relative a ciò di altri raccolti. La patata ha provenuto in Sudamerica, in qualche luogo in Perù attuale. Le patate sono importanti alla cultura delle Ande, dove i contadini crescono molte varietà diverse che hanno un'eccezionale diversità di colori e le forme. Le patate stendono al riposo del mondo dopo che il contatto Europeo con le Americhe nei tardi 1400 e prima 1500 e ha poiché diventa un raccolto di campo importante.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La papa (tuberosum de Solanum) es una planta perenne del Solanaceae, o del solano, la familia, comúnmente crecido para su tubérculo feculento. Las papas son el mundo la mayoría de la cosecha extensamente crecida del tubérculo, y de la cuarta cosecha más grande en términos del producto fresco (después de arroz, después del trigo, y después del maíz), pero este situar es hinchado debido al contenido de la pleamar del pariente fresco de papas a eso de otras cosechas. La papa originó en Sudamérica, en algún lugar en Perú actual. Las papas son importantes a la cultura de los Andes, donde granjeros crecen muchas variedades diferentes que tienen una diversidad notable de colores y formas. Las papas esparcen al resto del mundo después de que el contacto europeo con las Américas en los tarde 1400 y 1500 tempranos y tienen desde que llega a ser una cosecha importante de campo.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The history of coffee begins in the 9th century. It is thought to have originated in the highlands of Ethiopia and spread to the rest of the world via Egypt and Europe. The word coffee is derived from the Arabic word Qah'wa, over Ottoman Turkish Kahve, which originally meant wine or other intoxicating liquors. Partly due to the Islamic prohibition on drinking alcohol, preparing and drinking coffee became an important social ritual. In the 15th century, Muslims introduced coffee in Persia, Egypt, northern Africa and Turkey, where the first cafeteria, Kiva Han, opened in 1475 in Constantinople. The stimulant effect of drinking coffee caused it to be forbidden among orthodox and conservative imams in Mecca in 1511 and in Cairo in 1532 by a theological court. In Egypt, coffeehouses and warehouses containing coffee cherries were sacked. But the product's popularity, particularly among intellectuals, led to the reversal of this decision in 1524 by an order of the Ottoman Turkish Sultan Selim I. From the Muslim world, coffee spread to Europe, where it became popular in the 17th century. Dutch traders were the first to start large scale import of coffee into Europe.

Du monde Musulman, la diffusion de café à Europe, où il est devenu populaire dans le 17e siècle. Les commerçants hollandais étaient le premier commencer la grande importation à l'échelle de café dans Europe.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Sulfur is the chemical element in the periodic table that has the symbol S and atomic number 16. It is an abundant, tasteless, odorless, multivalent non-metal. Sulfur, in its native form, is a yellow crystalline solid. In nature, it can be found as the pure element or as sulfide and sulfate minerals. It is an essential element for life and is found in two amino acids. Its commercial uses are primarily in fertilizers but it is also widely used in gunpowder, matches, insecticides and fungicides. Sulfur (Sanskrit, sulvari; Latin, sulpur) was known in ancient times, and is referred to in the Biblical Pentateuch (Genesis). The word itself probably is from the Arabic sufra meaning yellow, from the bright color of the naturally occurring form, although the Sanskrit name for sulfur, sulvari could also be interpreted as meaning "enemy of copper". English translations of the Bible commonly refer to sulfur as "brimstone", giving rise to the name of 'Fire and brimstone' sermons, in which listeners are reminded of the fate of eternal damnation that awaits the nonbelieving and unrepented. It is from this part of the Bible that Hell is implied to "smell of sulfur", although as mentioned above sulfur is in fact odorless. The "smell of sulfur" usually refers to the odor of hydrogen sulfide, e.g. from rotten eggs. Burning sulfur produces sulfur dioxide, the smell associated with burnt matches. Homer mentioned "pest-averting sulfur" in the 8th century BC and in 424 BC, the tribe of Boeotia destroyed the walls of a city by burning a mixture of coal, sulfur, and tar under them. Sometime in the 12th century, the Chinese invented gun powder which is a mixture of potassium nitrate (KNO3), carbon, and sulfur. Early alchemists gave sulfur its own alchemical symbol which was a triangle at the top of a cross. In the late 1770s, Antoine Lavoisier helped convince the scientific community that sulfur was an element and not a compound.

C'est un élément essentiel pour la vie et est trouvé dans deux acides aminés. Ses usages commerciaux sont principalement dans les engrais mais il largement est aussi utilisé dans la poudre, les allumettes, les insecticides et les fongicides. Le soufre (sanscrit, sulvari ; latin, sulpur) a été su dans les temps anciens, et est référé à dans le Pentateuque Biblique (la Genèse). Le mot que lui-même est probablement du jaune de sens de sufra arabe, de la couleur brillante de la forme naturellement arrivant, bien que le nom de sanscrit pour le soufre, sulvari pourrait être aussi interprété comme signifiant « l'ennemi de cuivre ». Les traductions anglaises de la Bible se réfèrent ordinairement au soufre comme le « soufre », engendrant le nom de ‹ le Feu et le soufre › les sermons, dans lequel auditeurs sont rappelé du sort de damnation éternelle qui attend le nonbelieving et unrepented. C'est de cette partie de la Bible que cet Enfer est impliqué « sentir de soufre », bien que comme mentionné au-dessus du soufre est en fait sans odeur. Le « l'odeur de soufre » se réfère d'habitude à l'odeur de sulphure d'hydrogène, par ex. des oeufs pourris. Le soufre ardent produit le dioxyde de soufre, l'odeur a associé avec les allumettes brûlées. A la maison mentionné « le soufre de peste-détournant » dans l'huitième siècle AV. J-C et dans 424 AV. J-C, la tribu de Boeotia a détruit les murs d'une ville en brûlant un mélange de charbon, le soufre, et le goudron sous eux. Un jour dans le 12e siècle, le Chinois a inventé la poudre de fusil qui est un mélange de nitrate de potassium (KNO3), le carbone, et le soufre. Les alchimistes premiers ont donné son propre symbole de alchemical qui était un triangle en haut d'une croix au soufre. Dans les 1770 derniers, Antoine Lavoisier a aidé convainc la communauté scientifique ce soufre était un élément et pas un composé.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Schwefel ist das chemische Element im periodischen Tisch, der das Symbol S und Ordnungszahl 16 hat. Es ist ein reichliches, geschmackloses, geruchloses, multivalent Nichtmetall. Schwefel, in seine eingeborene Form, ist ein gelber kristalliner Festkörper. In Natur kann es als das reine Element oder der als sulfide und schwefelige Mineralien gefunden werden. Es ist ein wesentliches Element für Leben und ist in zwei Aminosäuren gefunden. Seine gewerblichen Gebräuche sind hauptsächlich in Düngemitteln aber es ist auch allgemein in Schießpulver, Gegenstücken, Insektengiften und Fungiziden benutzt. Schwefel (Sanskrit, sulvari; Latein, sulpur) wurde in alten Zeiten gewusst, und ist in den Biblischen Pentateuch (Entstehung) gesehen. Das Wort, das sich wahrscheinlich vom arabischen sufra Bedeutung Gelb ist, von der hellen Farbe von der natürlich stattfindenden Form, obwohl der Sanskrit Name für Schwefel, sulvari könnten auch interpretiert werden, als „Feind des Kupfers“ bedeutend. Englische Übersetzungen von der Bibel sehen normalerweise Schwefel als „Schwefelstein“, den den Namen von ‚Feuer und Schwefelstein‘ Predigten verursacht, sind in welchen Zuhörern vom Schicksal von ewigem damnation erinnert, der den nonbelieving und unrepented erwartet. Es ist von diesem Teil von der Bibel jener Hölle ist besagt „um von Schwefel zu riechen“, obwohl wie oben erwähnten Schwefel eigentlich geruchlos ist. „Der Geruch des Schwefel“ sieht gewöhnlich den Geruch von Wasserstoff sulfide, z.B. von verdorbenen Eiern. Verbrennenschwefel stellt Schwefeldioxid, der Geruch her, der mit verbrannten Gegenstücken verbunden wird. Homer hat „Plage abwendenden Schwefel“ im 8. Jahrhundert BC erwähnt und in 424 BC, hat der Stamm von Boeotia die Wände von einer Stadt durch Verbrennen einer Mischung der Kohle, Schwefel, und Teer unter ihnen zerstört. Irgendwann im 12. Jahrhundert hat der Chinese Gewehrpulver erfunden, das eine Mischung von Kaliumnitrat ist (KNO3), Kohlenstoff, und Schwefel. Frühe Alchimisten haben Schwefel seinen eigenen alchemical Symbol gegeben, das ein Dreieck oben auf einem Kreuz war. In den späten 1770er Jahren Antoine Lavoisier, der geholfen ist, um die wissenschaftliche Gemeinschaft zu überzeugen, dass jener Schwefel ein Element und keine Zusammensetzung war.

Il Homer ha menzionato lo "zolfo di peste-distogliendo nel BC di secolo 8 ed in 424 BC, la tribù di Beozia ha distrutto i muri di una città bruciando un miscuglio di carbone, lo zolfo, ed il catrame sotto loro. Un giorno nel secolo 12, il cinese ha inventato la polvere di pistola che è un miscuglio di nitrato di potassio (KNO3), il carbonio, e lo zolfo. Prima alchimisti hanno dato il suo proprio simbolo alchimistico che era un triangolo in cima a una croce allo zolfo. Non nei tardi 1770, Antoine Lavoisier ha aiutato convince la comunità scientifica quello zolfo era un elemento ed un composto.

El azufre, en su forma nativa, es un sólido de cristal amarillo. En la naturaleza, puede ser encontrado como el puro elemento o como minerales de sulfuro y sulfato. Las traducciones inglesas de la Biblia se refieren comúnmente al azufre como "azufre", ocasionando el nombre de sermones de "fuego eterno", en cuál oyentes es recordado del destino de la condenación eterna que aguarda el nonbelieving y unrepented. Alguna vez en el siglo XII, el chino inventó polvo de fusil que es una mezcla del nitrato de potasio (KNO3), el carbón, y el azufre. Los alquimistas tempranos dieron azufre su propio símbolo alquímico que fue un triángulo a la cabeza de una cruz. En los tarde 1770, Antoine Lavoisier ayudó a convencer la comunidad científica que ese azufre no fue un elemento y un recinto.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Cultivated barley (H. vulgare) is descended from wild barley (Hordeum spontaneum), which grows wild in the Middle East. Both forms are diploid (2n=14 chromosomes). As wild barley is interfertile with domesticated barley, the two forms are often treated as one species, divided into Hordeum vulgare subsp. spontaneum (wild) and subsp. vulgare (domesticated). The main difference between the two forms is the brittle rachis of the former, which enables seed dispersal in the wild. The earliest finds of wild barley come from Epi-Paleolithic sites in the Levant, beginning in the Natufian. The earliest domesticated barley occurs at Aceramic Neolithic sites such as the (PPN B) layers of Tell Abu Hureyra in Syria. Barley was one of the first crops domesticated in the Near East, at the same time as einkorn and emmer wheat. Barley was, alongside emmer wheat, a staple cereal of ancient Egypt, where it was used to make bread and beer; together, these were a complete diet. The general name for barley is jt (hypothetically pronounced "eat"); šma (hypothetically pronounced "SHE-ma") refers to Upper Egyptian barley and is a symbol of Upper Egypt. The ritual significance of barley in ancient Greece possibly dates back to the earliest stages of the Eleusinian Mysteries. The preparatory kykeon or mixed drink of the initiates, prepared from barley and herbs, was referred to in the Homeric hymn to Demeter, who was also called "Barley-mother". Greek practice was to dry the barley groats and roast them before preparing the porridge, according to Pliny the Elder's Natural History (xviii.72). This produces malt that soon ferments and becomes slightly alcoholic. Tibetan barley has been the only major staple food in Tibet for centuries. TEXT.French: [TAB]L'orge cultivé (H. vulgare) est descendu de l'orge sauvage (Hordeum spontaneum), qui grandit sauvage dans le Moyen-orient. Les deux formes sont diploïdes (2n=14 chromosomes). Comme l'orge sauvage est interfertile avec l'orge domestiquée, les deux formes sont souvent traitées comme une espèce, divisé en Hordeum vulgare subsp. spontaneum (sauvage) et subsp. vulgare (domestiqué). La différence principale entre les deux formes est le rachis fragile de l'ancien, qui rend capable la dispersion de semence dans le sauvage. Les découvertes les plus premières d'orge sauvage viennent des sites Epi-paléolithiques dans le Levant, commençant dans le Natufian. L'orge domestiquée la plus première arrive à Aceramic les sites néolithiques tels que le (le B DE PPN) les couches de Dit Abu Hureyra dans Syrie. L'orge était une des premières récoltes domestiquées dans l'Est Proche, en même temps comme le blé de einkorn et emmer. L'orge était, à côté du blé de emmer, une céréale d'agrafe d'Egypte ancienne, où il a été utilisé pour faire du pain et la bière ; ensemble, ceux-ci étaient un régime complet. Le nom général pour l'orge est jt (hypothétiquement prononcé « mange ») ; šma (SHE-ma hypothétiquement prononcé) réfère à l'orge égyptienne Supérieure et est un symbole d'Egypte Supérieure. La signification rituelle d'orge dans la Gréce antique remonte à probablement les étapes les plus premières des Mystères de Eleusinian. Le kykeon préparatoire ou la boisson mélangée de l'inaugure, préparé de l'orge et des herbes, a été référé à dans l'hymne Homérique à Demeter, qui a été aussi appelé l'Orge-Mère. La pratique grecque était de sécher le gruau d'avoine d'orge et les rôtit avant de préparer le porridge, selon Pliny l'Histoire Naturel Aîné (xviii.72). Ceci produit le malt qui fermente bientôt et devient légèrement alcoolique. L'orge tibétaine a été la seule nourriture d'agrafe majeure dans Tibet pour les siècles. Palaeoethnobotanists a trouvé cette orge a été grandie dans la Péninsule coréenne depuis la Période de Poterie de Mumun Première (c. 1500-850 av. J.-C.) avec les autres récoltes telles que millet, le blé, et les légumineuses.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Gepflegte Gerste (H. vulgare) ist von wilder Gerste (Hordeum spontaneum) abgestiegen, die wild im Nahen Osten wächst. Beide Formen sind diploid (2n= 14 Chromosomen). Als wilde Gerste interfertile mit domestizierter Gerste ist, sind die zwei Formen oft als eine Spezies behandelt, die in Hordeum vulgare subsp geteilt wird,. spontaneum (wild) und subsp. vulgare (domestiziert). Der Hauptunterschied zwischen den zwei Formen ist der spröd rachis vom ehemaligen, das Samenauflockerung im wilden ermöglicht. Die frühesten Funde wilder Gerste kommen von Epi-Paläolithischen Stellen im Durchbrennt, beginnend im Natufian. Die am frühesten domestizierte Gerste findet an Aceramic Jungsteinzeitlichen Stellen statt wie zum Beispiel das (PPN B) Schichten von Erzählt Abu Hureyra in Syrien. Gerste war eine der ersten Ernten, die im Nahen Osten domestiziert worden sind, der gleichzeitig als einkorn und der emmer Weizen. Gerste war, längsseits emmer Weizens, eines Heftklammergetreides alten Ägyptens, wo es benutzt wurde, Brot und Bier zu machen; zusammen, waren diese eine vollständige Diät. Der allgemeine Name für Gerste ist jt (hypothetisch ausgesprochen „isst“); šma (hypothetisch ausgesprochen „SHE-ma“) sieht Obere ägyptische Gerste und ist ein Symbol Oberen Ägyptens. Die Ritualwichtigkeit der Gerste in altem Griechenland datiert vielleicht zurück zu den frühesten Phasen dem Eleusinian Geheimnissen. Der vorbereitend kykeon oder hat Getränk vom einleitet, vorbereitet von Gerste und Kräutern, wurde gesehen ins Homerische Kirchenlied zu Demeter gemischt, der auch „Gerstemutter“ gerufen wurde. Griechische Praxis sollte die Gerste groats trocknen und sollte sie vor Vorbereiten des Breis, gemäß Pliny die Naturkunde des Älteren (xviii.72) braten. Dies stellt Malz her, das bald gärt und wird, etwas alkoholisch. Tibetische Gerste ist die einzige Hauptheftklammerspeise in Tibet für Jahrhunderte gewesen. Palaeoethnobotanists hat jene Gerste ist gewachsen worden in der koreanischen Halbinsel seit der Frühen Mumun Töpferei Periode gefunden (c. 1500-850 B.C.) zusammen mit anderen Ernten wie zum Beispiel Hirse, Weizen, und Hülsenfrucht.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]L'orzo coltivato (H. il vulgare) è disceso dall'orzo selvaggio (lo spontaneum di Hordeum), che cresce selvaggio nel Medio Oriente. Entrambe le forme sono delle diploid (2n=14 i cromosomi). L'orzo come selvaggio è l'interfertile con l'orzo reso casaliuto, le due forme sono spesso trattate come una specie, ha diviso nel subsp di vulgare di Hordeum. lo spontaneum (selvaggio) ed il subsp. il vulgare (reso casaliuto). La differenza principale tra le due forme è il rachis fragile del precedente, che permette la dispersione di semenza nel selvaggio. Le prima scoperte di orzo selvaggio vengono dai luoghi Epi-Paleolitici nel Levante, iniziando nel Natufian. Il presto ha reso casalingo l'orzo accade al Neolitico di Aceramic situa come il (PPN B) gli strati di Dice Hureyra a Abu in Siria. L'orzo era uno dei primi raccolti resi casaliuto nel Vicino Oriente, allo stesso tempo come il frumento di einkorn ed emmer. L'orzo era, accanto il frumento di emmer, un unisce con cucitrice il cereale di Egitto antico, dove è stato usato per fare il pane e la birra; insieme, questi erano una dieta completa. Il nome generale per l'orzo è il jt (ipoteticamente pronunciato "mangia"); šil ma (il SHE-ma ipoteticamente pronunciato) fa riferimento all'orzo Superiore egiziano ed è un simbolo di Egitto Superiore. Il significato rituale di orzo in Grecia antica forse date sostengono ai prima palcoscenici dei Misteri di Eleusinian. Il kykeon preparatorio o la bevanda mescolata dell'inizia, preparato dall'orzo e dalle erbe, è stato fatto riferimento a nell'inno Omerico a Demeter, che è stato anche chiamato l'Orzo-Madre. La pratica greca era asciugare le monete d'argento di orzo e loro arrostisce prima di preparare la crema d'avena, secondo Pliny la storia naturale dell'Anziano (xviii.72). Questo produce il malto che fermenta presto e diventa un po'alcoolico. L'orzo tibetano è stato il solo maggiore unisce con cucitrice il cibo in Tibet per i secoli. Il Palaeoethnobotanists ha trovato quell'orzo è stato cresciuto nella Penisola coreana dal Prima Periodo di Terraglie di Mumun (c. 1500-850 A.C.) con gli altri raccolti come il miglio, col frumento, e con i legumi.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La cebada cultivada (H. vulgare) es descendido de la cebada silvestre (spontaneum de Hordeum), que crece salvajemente en el Oriente Medio. Ambas formas son los cromosomas (2n=14 diploides). Cuando cebada silvestre es interfertile con domesticó cebada, las dos formas a menudo se tratan como una especie, dividido en el subsp de vulgare de Hordeum. spontaneum (tierra virgen) y subsp. vulgare (domesticó). La diferencia principal entre las dos formas es el rachis quebradizo del anterior, que permite la dispersión de la semilla en la tierra virgen. Los hallazgos más tempranos de cebada silvestre vienen de sitios Epi-paleolíticos en el Oriente Medio, empezando en el Natufian. El domesticó temprano cebada ocurre en Aceramic los sitios Neolíticos tales como el (PPN B) capas de Dice Abu Hureyra en Siria. La cebada era uno de las primeras cosechas domesticó en el Cercano Oriente, a la vez que trigo de einkorn y emmer. La cebada era, al costado trigo de emmer, un cereal básico de Egipto antiguo, donde lo se utilizó para hacer pan y cerveza; junto, éstos eran una dieta completa. El nombre general para la cebada es jt (hipotéticamente pronunciado "come"); šma (SHE-ma hipotéticamente pronunciado) se refiere a la cebada egipcia Superior y es un símbolo de Alto Egipto. El significado ritual de cebada en Grecia antigua antedata posiblemente a las etapas más tempranas de los Misterios de Eleusinian. El kykeon preparatorio o la bebida mezclada del inicia, preparado de la cebada e hierbas, se refirió a en el himno Homérico a Demeter, que se llamó también a Cebada-Madre. La práctica griega debía secar la avena de cebada y los asa antes de preparar el caldo, según Pliny la Historia (xviii.72 Natural del Anciano). Esto produce malta que pronto fermenta y llega a ser levemente alcoholica. La cebada tibetana ha sido el único alimento básico mayor en Tibet por siglos. Palaeoethnobotanists ha encontrado que esa cebada se ha crecido en la Península coreano desde que el Período Temprano de Alfarería de Mumun (C. 1500-850 aC) junto con otras cosechas tales como mijo, el trigo, y las legumbres.
TEXT.Russian: [TAB]Cultivated barley (H. vulgare) is descended from wild barley (Hordeum spontaneum), which grows wild in the Middle East. Both forms are diploid (2n=14 chromosomes). As wild barley is interfertile with domesticated barley, the two forms are often treated as one species, divided into Hordeum vulgare subsp. spontaneum (wild) and subsp. vulgare (domesticated). The main difference between the two forms is the brittle rachis of the former, which enables seed dispersal in the wild. The earliest finds of wild barley come from Epi-Paleolithic sites in the Levant, beginning in the Natufian. The earliest domesticated barley occurs at Aceramic Neolithic sites such as the (PPN B) layers of Tell Abu Hureyra in Syria. Barley was one of the first crops domesticated in the Near East, at the same time as einkorn and emmer wheat. Barley was, alongside emmer wheat, a staple cereal of ancient Egypt, where it was used to make bread and beer; together, these were a complete diet. The general name for barley is jt (hypothetically pronounced "eat"); šma (hypothetically pronounced "SHE-ma") refers to Upper Egyptian barley and is a symbol of Upper Egypt. The ritual significance of barley in ancient Greece possibly dates back to the earliest stages of the Eleusinian Mysteries. The preparatory kykeon or mixed drink of the initiates, prepared from barley and herbs, was referred to in the Homeric hymn to Demeter, who was also called "Barley-mother". Greek practice was to dry the barley groats and roast them before preparing the porridge, according to Pliny the Elder's Natural History (xviii.72). This produces malt that soon ferments and becomes slightly alcoholic. Tibetan barley has been the only major staple food in Tibet for centuries. Palaeoethnobotanists have found that barley has been grown in the Korean Peninsula since the Early Mumun Pottery Period (c. 1500-850 B.C.) along with other crops such as millet, wheat, and legumes.

TEXT.English: [TAB]It is believed that tobacco began growing in the Americas about 6,000 BCE, and by 1 BCE Native Americans were using tobacco in spiritual rituals and social gatherings. On October 15, 1492 Columbus was presented with a gift of dried tobacco leaves by the Native Americans. Soon after, it was brought to Europe where its popularity soared as people thought it cured everything from bad breath to cancer. The opposite, of course, was true. In 1847 Phillip Morris established selling hand rolled Turkish cigarettes. Cigarettes have served in every war since WW I, and have become entwined with images of war in the modern era. The active ingredient, Nicotine, is a highly toxic liquid alkaloid which has since been recognized as severely detrimental to health. The neuro-depressant is highly addictive, and also suppresses appetite while increasing blood pressure. New users experience a "high," while experienced users feel simple satisfaction.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Certains types de plantes ont évolué de telle manière qu'elles produisent des toxines rendant leur odeur ou leur saveur insupportable pour les animaux. Curieusement, ces odeurs et ces saveurs ont incité l'homme à rechercher ces plantes. Les marchands du Moyen-Orient ont cré vers 2000 av. J.-C. un marché des épices extrêmement lucratif. Les épices sont utilisées aujourd'hui, comme par le passé, pour conserver la nourriture et rehausser le goût des mets. Bien que de nos jours les épices soient cultivées et préparées à échelle commerciale, la plupart peuvent encore être trouvées en grande quantité dans la nature. Certaines des épices les plus recherchées, comme la muscade ou le clou de girofle, sont extraites de plantes qui poussent dans les régions tropicales ou marécageuses.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Bestimmte Pflanzen produzieren milde Gifte oder abstoßende Stoffe, deren Geruch oder Geschmack Tiere fernhält. Interessanterweise sind viele dieser Pflanzen bei den Menschen gerade wegen ihres Geruchs oder Geschmacks begehrt. Bereits 2000 vor Christus entstand im nahen Osten ein profitabler Gewürzhandel. Damals wie heute werden Gewürze benutzt, um Nahrungsmittel zu konservieren und ihren Geschmack zu verbessern. Zwar werden die Gewürzpflanzen mittlerweile kommerziell angebaut und aufbereitet, die meisten Sorten sind aber nach wie vor in großen Mengen auch in der freien Natur zu finden. Viele der beliebtesten Gewürze, wie Nelken und Muskat, werden aus Pflanzen gewonnen, die in den tropischen oder sumpfigen Regionen der Welt wachsen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Alcuni tipi di piante si sono evoluti in modo da produrre tossine leggere o repellenti per rendere il loro odore o il loro sapore nauseante per gli animali. Stranamente, gli umani cercano queste piante proprio per queste caratteristiche; i mercanti del Medio Oriente cominciarono il commercio di spezie prima del 2000 a. C. Al giorno d'oggi, le spezie vengono usate per conservare e condire i cibi. Malgrado al giorno d'oggi molte spezie vengano coltivate e preparate industrialmente, la maggior parte si possono trovare abbondantemente in natura. Molte delle spezie più popolari, come i chiodi di garofano e le noci moscate, si estraggono da piante che crescono in regioni tropicali e paludose.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Este perfume resinoso es hoy en día un artículo de lujo, igual que lo ha sido a lo largo de la historia, y produce una amplia y potente variedad de fragancias cuando se quema. La suma de flores, corteza de árbol, madera y resina puede crear una fragancia específica que la humanidad ha incorporado a muchos aspectos de la vida diaria. El incienso se solía quemar en un "incensario", que era un cuenco profusamente ornamentado. Los antiguos egipcios usaban este objeto en muchas de sus ceremonias religiosas. Dos de los tres regalos llevados por los Reyes Magos al nacimiento de Cristo fueron mirra e incienso, dos tipos de sustancias aromáticas. En la actualidad, el incienso se usa por las fragancias aromáticas que despide y en ceremonias de muchas iglesias cristianas.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The olive (Olea europaea) is a species of small tree native to the eastern Mediterranean which bears a fruit bearing the same name. The olive is a bitter fruit but can be eaten (usually after some kind of fermentation or curing) or used to make olive oil. It is not known exactly when olive trees first began being cultivated by humans, but they have been in use since at least 3000 BC. The olive is native to Greece and Palestine, but was later spread to the western Mediterranean and (eventually) all over the world, as it is grown today in California and Australia.[PARAGRAPH:1]Olives and olive oil both possessed special religious significance for the ancient Greeks. According to legend, the olive tree was created by the goddess Athena and used to win a contest with the god Poseidon over who would name a newly founded city; as a result of her gift of the olive, the city of Athens bears her name to this day. The ancient Greeks considered the olive to be sacred; it was a symbol of peace, wisdom, and triumph. Olive wreaths were used to crown Olympic champions. Olive oil was used in Hellenic religious ceremonies, and to this day it continues to possess a special importance in the Greek Orthodox Church. The olive continues to be of economic importance to Greece, which exports more than 400,000 tons of olive oil worldwide each year.
TEXT.French: />[TAB]L'olivier (Olea europaea) est une espèce d'arbre de petite taille originaire de l'est de la Méditerranée, et qui produit l'olive. L'olive est un fruit amer comestible (généralement seulement après fermentation ou salaison), également utilisé pour son huile. On ne sait pas exactement quand les premiers oliviers ont été cultivés par les hommes, mais cela date au minimum de l'an 3000 av. J.-C. L'arbre, originaire de Grèce et de Palestine, s'est répandu dans l'ouest de la Méditerranée et finalement un peu partout dans le monde, puisqu'on en trouve aujourd'hui en Californie et en Australie.[PARAGRAPH:1]Les olives et l'huile d'olive avaient une signification religieuse particulière pour les Grecs de l'Antiquité. Selon les légendes, l'olivier a été créé et utilisé par la déesse Athéna pour gagner une épreuve contre le dieu Poséidon, le vainqueur obtenant le droit de nommer une nouvelle cité. C'est ainsi que la ville d'Athènes aurait été baptisée. Les anciens Grecs considéraient l'olive comme sacrée. Elle était un symbole de paix, de sagesse et de victoire. Des couronnes d'oliviers récompensaient les champions olympiques d'alors. L'huile d'olive était utilisée dans les cérémonies religieuses helléniques et a encore de nos jours une grande importance dans le culte de l'église orthodoxe grecque. C'est toujours une des principales productions de la Grèce qui en exporte annuellement plus de 400 000 tonnes dans le monde entier.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Olivenbaum (Olea Europaea) ist ein kleiner, im östlichen Mittelmeerraum beheimateter Baum, der die so genannten Olivenfrüchte trägt. Die Olive ist eine bittere, aber essbare Frucht (normalerweise nach einem Gärungsvorgang oder dem Marinieren/Einlegen z. B. in Wasser) und dient als Grundlage für die Herstellung von Olivenöl. Wann genau die Olivenbäume erstmals von den Menschen kultiviert wurden, ist nicht bekannt, aber sie werden seit mindestens 3000 vor Christus landwirtschaftlich genutzt. Ursprünglich in Griechenland und Palästina heimisch, fand die Olive später auch im westlichen Mittelmeerraum und schließlich in der ganzen Welt Verbreitung. Heute wird sie sogar in Kalifornien und Australien angebaut. [PARAGRAPH:1]Oliven und Olivenöl hatten für die Griechen der Antike eine besondere religiöse Bedeutung. Überlieferungen zufolge soll der Olivenbaum von der Göttin Athene erschaffen worden sein, die damit einen Wettstreit gegen Poseidon gewinnen wollte, bei dem entschieden wurde, wer von den beiden eine neue Stadt nach sich benennen darf. Am Ende konnte sich Athene mit ihrer Olive durchsetzen und so wurde die Stadt Athen nach ihr benannt. Für die Griechen der Antike war die Olive eine heilige Frucht: Sie symbolisierte Frieden, Weisheit und den Triumph. Aus diesem Grund wurden siegreiche Olympioniken schon damals mit einem Olivenzweig geehrt. Das Olivenöl wurde in religiösen hellenistischen Zeremonien verwendet und hat in der griechisch-orthodoxen Kirche nach wie vor besondere Bedeutung. Außerdem stellt die Olive bis heute auch einen wichtigen Wirtschaftsfaktor für Griechenland dar, das jedes Jahr mehr als 400.000 Tonnen Olivenöl in die ganze Welt exportiert.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]L'ulivo (olea europaea) è un piccolo albero nativo del Mediterraneo orientale e produce le olive, frutti amari che possono essere mangiati (di solito dopo essere stati fatti fermentare o comunque dopo una qualche preparazione) o utilizzati per ricavarne olio d'oliva. Non si sa esattamente quando gli alberi d'ulivo cominciarono a essere coltivati, ma di certo già lo erano nel 3000 a.C. L'ulivo è originario della Grecia e della Palestina, ma più tardi si diffuse nel Mediterraneo occidentale e poi in tutto il mondo: oggi lo si coltiva anche in Australia e California.[PARAGRAPH:1]Le olive o l'olio d'oliva avevano entrambi uno speciale significato religioso per gli antichi Greci. Secondo la leggenda, l'ulivo fu creato dalla dea Atena per vincere una disputa con il dio Poseidone su chi avrebbe dovuto dare il nome a una città appena fondata: per aver ricevuto in dono l'ulivo, la città scelse di chiamarsi Atene (nome che porta ancora oggi). I Greci consideravano l'ulivo sacro: era simbolo di pace, saggezza e trionfo. Corone d'ulivo venivano utilizzate per incoronare i campioni olimpici e l'olio d'oliva era usato in molte cerimonie religiose elleniche e ancora oggi ha una speciale importanza nella Chiesa Greco-Ortodossa. L'ulivo per la Grecia continua ad avere anche un rilevante ruolo economico, dato che il paese esporta più di 400.000 tonnellate all'anno d'olio d'oliva in tutto il mondo.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El olivo (olea europaea) es un pequeño árbol de la familia de las oleáceas originario del Mediterráneo oriental que, como su nombre indica, da de fruto las olivas. Es originario de Grecia y Palestina, pero primero se extendió por el Mediterráneo occidental y después por todo el mundo, ya que hoy en día se cultiva hasta en California y Australia.[PARAGRAPH:1]Las olivas, los olivos y el aceite tenían un significado religioso para los antiguos griegos. Se usaban tocados de ramas y hojas olivo para coronar a los campeones olímpicos. El aceite de oliva se usaba en las ceremonias religiosas helénicas y, en la actualidad, tiene una gran importancia para la Iglesia Ortodoxa griega. El olivo sigue siendo de una gran importancia económica para Grecia, que exporta al año más de 400.000 toneladas a todo el mundo.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Salt has been one of the most valued commodities in the history of mankind - among other reasons, humans need a certain amount of salt in their diet to survive. Humans have been harvesting salt for thousands of years; the practice started in the dim recesses of history, long before any written records were made. [PARAGRAPH:2]One of salt's greatest properties is its ability to preserve food. Before the development of reliable refrigeration, one of the few known ways to keep food from becoming inedible was to apply salt, which delays or prevents microbial invasion. (Some kinds of foods can also by preserved by "smoking" them.) In addition to its preservative qualities, salt also simply makes food taste better. [PARAGRAPH:2]One of the earliest-discovered methods of harvesting salt was by evaporating seawater under the sun, a very tedious and expensive process, leading to high prices for this important good. It wouldn't be until the mid-nineteenth century - when salt mining was widely practiced across the world - that this commodity would become much less expensive, no longer "worth its weight in gold," as it was commonly described.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le sel est l'un des produits de base les plus convoités de l'histoire de l'humanité, entre autres raisons parce que les humains ont besoin d'en absorber une certaine quantité pour vivre. L'homme récolte le sel depuis des milliers d'années, une pratique initiée au fin fond des recoins obscurs de son histoire, bien avant que l'écriture n'ait été inventée. [PARAGRAPH:2]L'une des grandes propriétés du sel est sa capacité de conservation des aliments. Avant l'invention et le développement de la réfrigération, l'un des rares moyens de conserver la nourriture est de la saler abondamment, ce qui retarde ou empêche les bactéries de s'y développer (il était aussi possible de conserver certains aliments en les fumant). Par ailleurs, le sel donne plus de goût à la nourriture. [PARAGRAPH:2]L'un des premiers moyens découverts pour la récolte du sel est la méthode d'évaporation au soleil, un processus coûteux et fastidieux, qui produit un sel cher. Il faut attendre la moitié du XIXe siècle et l'exploitation du sel répandue dans le monde entier pour que ce produit de base devienne bien meilleur marché et cesse de parfois coûter son poids en or, comme on avait l'habitude de l'affirmer.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Salz gehörte in der Geschichte der Menschheit stets zu den wertvollsten Gütern überhaupt, nicht zuletzt auch deshalb, weil der menschliche Körper einen bestimmten Salzgehalt über die Nahrung aufnehmen muss, um überleben zu können. Dementsprechend setzten sich die Menschen schon vor Tausenden von Jahren, weit vor der Geschichtsschreibung, mit der Salzgewinnung auseinander. [PARAGRAPH:2]Eine der wichtigsten Eigenschaften des Salzes ist, dass es bakteriellen Befall verzögert oder gar verhindert und daher verwendet werden kann, um Lebensmittel haltbarer zu machen. Dementsprechend wurden Nahrungsmittel in der Zeit vor der Verfügbarkeit zuverlässiger Kühlsysteme durch Zufügen von Salz vor dem Verrotten bewahrt. (Für manche Lebensmittel ist jedoch die "Räuchermethode" besser geeignet.) Darüber hinaus diente Salz aber natürlich auch als Würzmittel. [PARAGRAPH:2]Eine der frühesten Salzgewinnungsmethoden war es, Salzwasser in der Sonne verdunsten zu lassen - ein sehr langwieriger und aufwändiger Prozess, der den Preis für dieses wichtige Gut rasant in schwindelnde Höhen schnellen ließ. Erst Mitte des 19. Jahrhunderts, als der Salzabbau schließlich in der ganzen Welt praktiziert wurde, rückten auch die Preise wieder in erschwingliche Bereiche und Salz musste nicht mehr sprichwörtlich "in Gold aufgewogen" werden.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il sale è sempre stato uno dei beni più preziosi della storia dell'umanità: tra le altre cose, l'uomo ha bisogno di una certa quantità di sale nella dieta per sopravvivere. L'uomo ha prodotto il sale per migliaia di anni, sin dall'inizio della storia e anzi molto prima che esistessero documenti scritti. [PARAGRAPH:2]Una della più notevoli proprietà del sale è quella di preservare i cibi. Prima dello sviluppo di un sistema di refrigerazione affidabile, oltre all'affumicazione uno dei pochi modi conosciuti per evitare che il cibo andasse a male era metterlo sotto sale (il sale ostacola o impedisce l'accumulo di batteri); senza contare che oltre a conservare il cibo, esso ne esalta il sapore. [PARAGRAPH:2]Uno dei primi metodi scoperti per produrre il sale fu far evaporare l'acqua marina al sole, un procedimento lungo e costoso che manteneva alto il prezzo del sale. Solo alla metà del diciannovesimo secolo (quando le miniere di sali erano ormai comuni in tutto il mondo) il prezzo del sale scese sensibilmente e il sale smise di costare "tanto oro quanto pesava", come si diceva allora.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La sal ha sido una de las mercancías más valiosas de la historia de la humanidad: entre otras razones, los hombres necesitan cierta cantidad de sal en su dieta para sobrevivir. Se lleva extrayendo miles de años. La práctica se inició al principio de los tiempos, mucho antes de que existieran registros escritos. [PARAGRAPH:2]Una de las más importantes propiedades de la sal es su capacidad para conservar la comida. Antes de que se inventaran sistemas de refrigeración fiables, una de las pocas formas conocidas para impedir que la comida se estropeara era aplicar una capa de sal, capaz de demorar o prevenir las invasiones microbianas (algunos tipos de comida pueden ser preservados ahumándolos). Además de estas propiedades, la sal hace que las cosas sepan mejor. [PARAGRAPH:2]Uno de los métodos más antiguos para extraer sal era la evaporación del agua del mar, un proceso tedioso y caro que encarecía los precios de esta importante mercancía. No sería hasta mediados del siglo XIX, con la extensión de la minería de la sal por todo el mundo, cuando esta mercancía bajara su precio y dejara de valer "su peso en oro", como solía decirse.
TEXT.Russian: [TAB]Salt has been one of the most valued commodities in the history of mankind - among other reasons, humans need a certain amount of salt in their diet to survive. Humans have been harvesting salt for thousands of years; the practice started in the dim recesses of history, long before any written records were made. [PARAGRAPH:2]One of salt's greatest properties is its ability to preserve food. Before the development of reliable refrigeration, one of the few known ways to keep food from becoming inedible was to apply salt, which delays or prevents microbial invasion. (Some kinds of foods can also by preserved by "smoking" them.) In addition to its preservative qualities, salt also simply makes food taste better. [PARAGRAPH:2]One of the earliest-discovered methods of harvesting salt was by evaporating seawater under the sun, a very tedious and expensive process, leading to high prices for this important good. It wouldn't be until the mid-nineteenth century - when salt mining was widely practiced across the world - that this commodity would become much less expensive, no longer "worth its weight in gold," as it was commonly described.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Made from the leaves or buds of a bush, tea is the liquid created by soaking the extracted foliage in water and it is a popular beverage throughout the world. The "Camellia Sinesis," (tea plant), is grown in tropical and sub-tropical regions of the planet such as China or India. Originally from Southeast Asia, it early on became a staple in the diet of many person from the Orient. It was not until the sixteenth or seventeenth century that it was introduced to Europe as explorers crossed the globe in search of knowledge and treasure. Tea quickly became popular with the wealthy of Western Europe, and Britain would set up numerous plantations in its colony of India to help satiate the demand - India today remains the biggest producer of tea in the world.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Constitué de feuilles ou de bourgeons d'un buisson, le thé est préparé en trempant l'extrait de feuillage dans de l'eau, et c'est une boisson extrêmement populaire à travers le monde. Le "Camellia Sinesis" (la plante) pousse dans les régions tropicales et subtropicales de la planète, et notamment en Chine et en Inde. Originaire d'Asie du Sud-est, le thé devient très tôt un produit de base dans le régime alimentaire de nombreux habitants de l'Orient. Il n'est pas introduit avant le XVIe ou XVIIe siècles en Europe, quand les explorateurs font le tour du monde en quête de nouvelles connaissances et richesses. Le thé devient vite très populaire au sein des classes supérieures de l'Europe de l'ouest et la Grande-Bretagne crée de nombreuses plantations dans ses colonies des Indes pour répondre à la demande. L'Inde reste aujourd'hui le premier producteur mondial.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Als Aufguss aus den Blättern oder Knospen eines Busches zubereitet, ist Tee zu einem weltweit beliebten Getränk geworden. Die "Camellia Sinensis" (Teegewächs) wird in tropischen und subtropischen Regionen wie China oder Indien angebaut. Ursprünglich aus Südostasien stammend, wurde der Tee zu einem wichtigen Bestandteil der orientalischen Ernährungsweise. Erst im 16. oder 17. Jahrhundert brachten Forschungsreisende die Teepflanze schließlich auch nach Europa. Da der Tee als Getränk im reichen Westeuropa großen Anklang fand, legten die Briten in ihrer Kolonie Indien zahlreiche Plantagen an, um die steigende Nachfrage befriedigen zu können, und auch heute noch gehört Indien zu den größten Tee produzierenden Ländern der Welt.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Ricavato dalle foglie o dalle gemme di un arbusto, il tè è una bevanda popolare in tutto il mondo che si ottiene immergendo le foglie nell'acqua calda. la "camellia sinesis" (la pianta del tè) cresce nelle regioni tropicali e sub-tropicali del pianeta (Cina e India, per esempio). Originario del sudest asiatico, ben presto il tè entrò a far parte della dieta di molti orientali, mentre fu introdotto in Europa soltanto nel sedicesimo o diciassettesimo secolo, portato da esploratori che giravano il mondo in lungo e in largo in cerca di nuove conoscenze e tesori. Il tè raccolse in breve tempo il consenso delle classi agiate europee e per soddisfare la domanda, l'Inghilterra creò enormi piantagioni in India, che ancora oggi rimane il più grande produttore di tè al mondo.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El té, líquido creado por la infusión en agua de las hojas o los brotes de un matorral, es una bebida que goza de gran fama en todo el mundo. La "camellia sinesis" (planta del té) crece en regiones tropicales y subtropicales del planeta, como China y la India. Procedente del sudeste de Asia, se convirtió desde muy pronto en la base de la dieta de muchos orientales. Hasta los siglos XVI o XVII no fue introducido en Europa por los aventureros que cruzaban el mundo en busca de conocimientos y tesoros. El té se hizo rápidamente popular entre la gente acomodada de Europa occidental, y los británicos crearían inmensas plantaciones en sus colonias de la India para satisfacer la demanda. En la actualidad, la India continúa siendo el mayor productor mundial.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The apple is the pomaceous fruit of the apple tree, species Malus domestica in the rose family Rosaceae. It is one of the most widely cultivated tree fruits. The tree is small and deciduous, reaching 5-12 m tall, with a broad, often densely twiggy crown.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La pomme est le fruit pomaceous du pommier, domestica de Malus d'espèces dans la famille rose Rosaceae. Elle est l'un des fruits le plus largement cultivés d'arbre. L'arbre est petit et à feuilles caduques, atteignant 5-12 m grand, avec une large, souvent en masse twiggy couronne.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Apfel ist die pomaceous Frucht des Apfelbaums, Sorte Malus domestica in der rose Familie Rosaceae. Er ist eine der weit bebauten Baumfrüchte. Der Baum ist klein und laubwechselnd und erreicht 5-12 m hoch, mit einer ausgedehnten, häufig dicht twiggy Krone.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La mela è la frutta pomaceous di di melo, domestica di Malus di specie nella famiglia di rosa Rosaceae. È una delle frutte il più ampiamente coltivate dell'albero. L'albero è piccolo e deciduo, raggiungendo 5-12 m. alto, con una vasta, parte superiore spesso densamente twiggy.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La manzana es la fruta pomaceous del manzano, domestica de Malus de la especie en la familia color de rosa Rosaceae. Es una de las frutas lo más extensamente posible cultivadas del árbol. El árbol es pequeño y de hojas caducas, alcanzando 5-12 m alto, con una corona amplia, a menudo denso twiggy.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A relic is an object or a personal item of religious significance, carefully preserved with an air of veneration as a tangible memorial. Relics are an important aspect of some forms of Buddhism, Christianity, Hinduism, Shamanism, and many other religions. [TAB]The word relic comes from the Latin reliquiae, meaning "remains." A reliquary is a shrine that houses one or more relics.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein Relikt ist ein Objekt oder ein persönlicher Gegenstand von religiöser Bedeutung, der aus tiefer Verehrung als ein greifbares Denkmal des Glaubens aufbewahrt wird. Relikte sind ein wichtiger Aspekt einiger Formen des Buddhismus, Hinduismus, Schamanismus, des Christentums und anderer Religionen. [TAB]Das Word "Relikt" kommt vom lateinischen "reliquiae", was "überreste" bedeutet. Ein "Reliquiar" ist ein Schrein, der eines oder mehrere Relikte beherbergt.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Honey is a sweet aliment produced by honey bees (and some other species) and derived from the nectar of flowers. Honey use and production has a long and varied history, reaching back approximately 10,000 years ago. In Ancient Egypt, honey was used to sweeten cakes and biscuits, and was a common ingredient in many other dishes. It was also cultivated for culinary purposes in ancient Mesoamerica; the Maya regarded the bee as sacred. But honey has associations that go beyond its use as a food. In Hinduism and Buddhism it serves as an offering in religious ceremonies, Ancient Egyptian and Middle-Eastern peoples used honey for embalming the dead and some cultures believe in its practical health use, e.g. as an ointment for rashes and burns or to soothe sore throats.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Honig ist ein süßes Nahrungsmittel, das von Honigbienen (und einigen anderen Spezies) aus dem Nektar von Blüten produziert wird. Die Produktion und der Gebrauch von Honig hat eine lange und abwechslungsreiche Geschichte, die vor ca. 10,000 Jahre begann. Im alten Ägypten wurde Honig zum Süßen von Kuchen und Gebäck verwendet und war eine gebräuchliche Zutat in vielen anderen Gerichten. Auch die Urvölker Mittelamerikas nutzen Honig für kulinarische Zwecke; die Maya betrachteten die Biene dabei als heilig. Aber Honig besitzt Assoziationen, die über ein simples Nahrungsmittel hinausgehen. Im Hinduismus und Buddhismus dient er als ein Opfer in religiösen Zeremonien, im Alten Ägypten und Nahen Osten gebrauchte man Honig zur Einbalsamierung der Toten und einige Kulturen glauben an seine heilenden Kräfte, z.B. als Heilsalbe für Ausschläge und Verbrennungen oder gegen Halsschmerzen.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Timber is a term used to describe wood; either standing or that has been processed for use as material for construction. Uses for timber in the ancient Mediterranean were numerous; uses included ship building, architecture, furniture, fortifications, tools, weapons, fuel, and many more. Proper timber was especially important in ship building and the availability of this wood dictated which nations could build and maintain navies. The need for timber in Greece, Crete, and the Italian Peninsula is thought to have cause severe deforestation in these regions and the need to import suitable timber from other regions. Important source regions for timber in the ancient Mediterranean included Crete, Germania, and Syria.

[TAB]In the Early Middle Ages, slavery was being slowly replaced by serfdom. In some areas outside of Western Europe, however, slaves were still a vital part of the economy. [TAB]In the Viking era starting c. 793, the Norse raiders often captured and enslaved their opponents. In Norway and Iceland the slaves were called Thralls. The thralls were mostly from Western Europe, among them many Franks, Irish and Anglo-Saxons. There is evidence of German and south European slaves as well. The Norse slavery came to an end with the breakthrough of christianity and national laws in the Scandinavian countries. [TAB]The Arab world has traded in slaves like many other cultures of the region. It was one of the oldest slave trades, predating the European transatlantic slave trade by hundreds of years. The Arab or Middle Eastern slave trade is thought to have originated with trans-Saharan slavery. The Moors, starting in the 8th century, raided coastal areas of the Mediterranean and Northern European (including British and even as far north as Scandinavian) coastal areas and would carry away sometimes whole villages to the Moorish slave markets on the Barbary Coast.

Important for production of cloth, cotton is a soft fiber which can be extracted from cotton plants. After removal from the plant, the fibers are processed to remove seeds and wax, and then they are spun into threads. Cotton grows well in both tropical and warm temperate climates, and it can be cultivated across much of the inhabited portions of the world.[PARAGRAPH:2]Many civilizations recognized the value cotton very early in their development - examples include the Egyptians, (Asian) Indians and even some pre-Colombian American cultures. The Industrial Revolution saw the invention of the "Spinning Jenny" and cotton gin, which enabled mass production of cotton-based cloth. After these developments the demand for the plant fiber became almost insatiable, driving up labor demands for its cultivation across the world - leading to, among other things, the continuation of slavery in the United States into the mid-nineteenth century. Today, however, most cotton in western nations is harvested mechanically. It remains an important good worldwide.
TEXT.French: Le coton, matière primordiale pour la production de tissus, est une fibre souple extraite de la plante du même nom. Après avoir été séparées de la plante, les fibres sont traitées afin d'en supprimer graines et cire, avant d'être filées. Le coton s'adapte particulièrement aux climats chauds ou tropicaux et peut être cultivé dans de nombreuses régions désertiques du monde.[PARAGRAPH:2]De nombreuses civilisations ont vite compris l'importance que pouvait avoir le coton pour leur développement, par exemple, les Egyptiens, les Indiens (d'Asie) et certaines cultures précolombiennes. L'invention, à la Révolution industrielle, de la Jenny (une machine à filer le coton) et de l'égreneuse à coton, va permettre une production massive de vêtements. Après ce développement, la demande pour cette fibre devient presque impossible à satisfaire, ce qui incite au développement de sa culture à travers le monde et entraîne, entre autres choses, la poursuite de l'esclavage aux Etats-Unis au XIXe siècle. De nos jours, la plus grande partie des récoltes du monde occidental est effectuée mécaniquement et le coton demeure un produit important dans le monde entier.
TEXT.German: Baumwolle ist eine weiche Faser, die aus der Baumwollpflanze gewonnen und vorwiegend in der Textilfertigung genutzt wird. Nach der Ernte werden die Samenhaare in einem ersten Verarbeitungsprozess zunächst von den Samen sowie von Wachsrückständen befreit und dann zu Fäden gesponnen. Besonders gut gedeiht die Baumwollpflanze in tropischem und warmem Klima, grundsätzlich kann sie aber in den meisten bewohnten Gebieten der Erde angebaut werden.[PARAGRAPH:2]Viele Zivilisationen erkannten bereits sehr früh den Wert der Baumwolle, so zum Beispiel die Ägypter, die Inder sowie einige präkolumbianische Kulturen auf dem amerikanischen Kontinent. Doch erst die Erfindung der "Spinning Jenny" (Spinnmaschine) und der "Cotton Gin" (Egreniermaschine zur Entkörnung von Baumwolle) im Zeitalter der Industriellen Revolution ermöglichte die Massenfertigung von Baumwolltextilien. In der darauf folgenden Zeit stieg die Nachfrage nach der Pflanzenfaser schier ins Unermessliche, so dass weltweit Unmengen von Arbeitskräften für den Anbau der Baumwollpflanze benötigt wurden - dies war unter anderem auch ein Grund dafür, dass die Sklaverei in den Vereinigten Staaten bis Mitte des 19. Jahrhunderts aufrechterhalten blieb. Heute wird Baumwolle, die nach wie vor zu den wichtigsten Handelsgütern der Welt gehört, in den westlichen Ländern überwiegend mechanisch geerntet.
TEXT.Italian: Importante per la produzione dell'abbigliamento, il cotone è una fibra soffice che si estrae dalla pianta di cotone. Dopo essere state estratte dalla pianta, le fibre vengono trattate per privarle di semi e cera, quindi sono filate (tessute in fili). Il cotone cresce bene nei climi tropicali e in quelli temperati e perciò è coltivabile in buona parte del mondo abitato.[PARAGRAPH:2]Molte civiltà, tra cui Egizi, Indiani (d'Asia) e certe culture pre-colombiane, hanno apprezzato sin da subito il valore del cotone. La Rivoluzione Industriale vide l'introduzione del "filatoio multiplo" e della sgranatrice, che permisero la produzione di massa dei capi in cotone. In seguito a questi sviluppi, la domanda di cotone divenne quasi insaziabile, facendo impennare la domanda di lavoro nelle piantagioni di cotone in tutto il mondo. Questo portò, tra le altre cose, alla continuazione della pratica della schiavitù negli Stati Uniti fino alla metà del diciannovesimo secolo. Oggi, invece, nelle nazioni occidentali il cotone è raccolto meccanicamente e rimane sempre un bene importante.
TEXT.Spanish: Importante para la producción de tela, el algodón es una fibra suave que se extrae de la planta de algodón. Tras su extracción, las fibras se procesan para quitarles las semillas y la cera y, a continuación, se utilizan para formar hebras. El algodón se cultiva en climas tanto tropicales como cálidos y puede producirse en buena parte de las regiones habitadas del mundo.[PARAGRAPH:2]Muchas civilizaciones reconocieron el valor del algodón en un momento muy temprano de su desarrollo. Entre los ejemplos más característicos tenemos a los egipcios, los hindúes e incluso algunas culturas precolombinas. La Revolución Industrial asistió a la invención de "Jenny la hilandera" y de la desmotadora, que permitían la producción en serie de tela de algodón. Tras estos inventos, la demanda de fibra de algodón se hizo casi insaciable y el cultivo de la planta se extendió por todo el mundo lo que, entre otras cosas, fomentó la supervivencia de la esclavitud en los Estados Unidos hasta el siglo XIX. En nuestros días, no obstante, en las naciones occidentales el algodón se recoge por medios mecánicos. Sigue siendo una mercancía importantísima en todo el mundo.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Access to East Asia was the original driving force of European exploration and colonization, but it was always on the minds of Western traders. The profit surrounding the trade- which included silk, spice, gold, and other valuable items, was immense, and has been coveted by the West ever since trade routes linked Orientals to Occidentals. [TAB]European trade with China has gone at least as far back as the infancy of the Roman Empire, whom traded with the Chinese Han Empire via a vast transcontinental trade route known as the Silk Road. The trade remained a very lucrative business, even after the fall of Rome, and goods from the East still flowed to the West despite the Silk Road falling into disrepair. This made travel more dangerous (and more expensive), but it made the goods that reached Europe all the more valuable. Constantinople was one of the first to profit off this trade, after the collapse of the Roman Empire due to its position on the most direct land and sea routes between Europe and Asia. Even the Emperor Justinian got in the act, by having silkworms smuggled from China. [TAB]The riches of the East, however, did not leave the thoughts of ambitious Europeans. Within a century, goods that were once transported across small seas on Italian galleys were replaced by Spanish and Portuguese caravels, carracks and galleons. The two kingdoms were racing to the Indies, the spice rich islands that had made the Egyptians so wealthy. Portugal headed west, as it had already been exploring the African coast and needed only to round the continent, which was accomplished by Bartolomeu Dias in 1488. Spain meanwhile, sent a Genovese navigator, named Christopher Columbus, to find the Indies- by sailing west. Setting off in August of 1492, three months later he landed in what he thought was Indonesia. Columbus' discovery shocked the Portuguese, who believed that their claims to the East had been stolen by the Spaniards, and a shouting match between the two Empires. The Pope finally put an end to their bickering with the Treaty of Tordesillas in 1494, which split the world into two halves, with Portugal ruling the East and Spain ruling the west. [TAB]Other European powers eventually searched for a path to the East as well. English, French, and Dutch explorers tried to find a "Northwest Passage" around North America and into the Pacific. Unsuccessful, they instead ousted the Portuguese from West Africa and now the Dutch established a colony on the very tip of South Africa, Cape Town, which became a frequented resupply post for Dutch (and later British) Ships on the way to India, China, and Indonesia. The French also tried to reach the East, indeed one of Napoleons' goals when invading Egypt in 1799 was finding a route to India, as traveling through the Red Sea was much faster than rounding Cape Town or Cape Horn, on the tip of South America. When the British, who more or less controlled both points, then took Egypt for themselves, they would exploit this by building the Suez Canal, and the United States did the same in Panama to unite its Atlantic and Pacific fleets. [TAB]Today, access to the East remains vital for Western businesses. Access to East Asia is much easier to achieve today with airports, Trans oceanic canals and even simply through the internet, but such access is crucial in and increasingly global economy with China becoming the world's prime industrial center, and India and Singapore as the high tech industry's chief locations for expansion.

[TAB]While the Iberian Kingdoms were busy exploring the New World's southern and western reaches, England, France, and the Netherlands began to prod the northern continent in the 16th and 17th centuries. The reasons for their explorations changed throughout the period. At first, nearly all of them were searching for the "Northwest Passage", a way around North America to the Pacific. After plenty of failures, mutinies, deaths, and lost money, the nations realized that their efforts were in vain, so they searched for other reasons to have a piece of the continent. [TAB]England found that America was an ideal place to put prisoners, relocate the religiously suppressed, grow cash crops, and "rid England of its surplus population"- in other words, send people out of the crowded cities, send them to Virginia, and hope they die. France found Quebec and Louisiana to be a land full of potential converts to Christianity (to which success was limited) and plenty of beaver, the pelts of which were in high demand in the 17th Century. The Dutch found an opportunity to shove more money into their already bulging pockets, and established profitable trading posts in New York, including New York City itself, even then a leading commercial center. Timber from North America was also an important resource for these seafaring nations, as there were few forests in left Western Europe with big enough trees for ship masts. [TAB]By the 19th Century, North America had new values that had yet to be exploited. The eastern US became a major industrial center, thanks to nearby coal mines and new canals. The middle section of the continent also found new valuable attributes: land to sell to settlers, cultivatable land to feed growing populations, and vast oil fields all the way from Texas to Canada and Alaska. Alaska, along with much of western North America, also had rich gold veins. Scattered all along the much west coast, these deposits sparked major gold rushes in the region several times in the century, in some cases establishing major population centers. [TAB]Today, with most of its oil drawn, gold mined, and industrial power nearly gone, it would first seem that North America had lost all of its economic value to the world. However, due to its consumerism society, North America is still a huge market for mass-produced goods. Also, the headquarters of several major high-tech companies are located here, which- along with consumerism- keeps North America in the world's global economy.

[TAB]Access to South America was a huge bonus to Spain and Portugal, the continent's main explorers. In fact, except its north eastern corner, the entire continent was taken by the two nations. This is due to the value of having South America often being more easily recognizable than in North America, and the pay off came much more sooner. [TAB]The western part of the continent was taken by Spain, for despite the arid climate and high altitude, among the Andes mountain range (and the empire inside it) was an astonishing amount of gold and silver. In the town of Potos, vein of 50 percent pure silver was struck, and the mining here was so rich that the money it accumulated- despite vast amounts exported to China, lost from smuggling, and the general lack of law and order in town- completely covered Spain's military budget for over a century. [TAB]The Portuguese had a later start, but still managed to claim and incredible amount of territory, known as Brazil. The wealth could be found among gold and diamonds, but soon it was found that even more money could be made by cutting down swaths of rainforests, planting sugarcane, tobacco, and coffee, and having the plantations worked by slaves from the Portuguese colony of Angola. On top the Angolans there were also plenty of native people to enslave as well, and some of the slavers made it all the way from Buenos Aries to Potosi, around 1500 miles away, and became silver smugglers. By the 19th century, Portugal conquered nearly the entire eastern continent; a vast amount of territory that was quite profitable, considering more sugarcane was now grown by Portugal than by another New World colony, and the money from slave depots and silver smugglers in Aries and Paulo. [TAB]In the modern day, South America has a very unstable political climate, with corruption, dictators, and juntas ever since the continent became independent. Sugarcane is still exported from Brazil, and Venezuela has oilfields, but unfortunately northwest South America- Columbia in particular- is now infamous for narcotics production. Still, there is hope for the continent, as tourism (due to Incan ruins and the Amazon rainforests, among others) is major boon to the economies of several counties, and Buenos Aries has since dropped its slave depots and now has a growing high-tech industry.

[TAB]The walrus (Odobenus rosmarus) is a large flippered marine mammal with a discontinuous circumpolar distribution in the Arctic Ocean and sub-Arctic seas of the Northern Hemisphere. The walrus is the only living species in the Odobenidae family and Odobenus genus. It is subdivided into three subspecies: the Atlantic Walrus (O. rosmarus rosmarus) which lives in the Atlantic Ocean, the Pacific Walrus (O. rosmarus divergens) which lives in the Pacific Ocean, and O. rosmarus laptevi, which lives in the Laptev Sea. [TAB]The walrus is immediately recognized by its prominent tusks, whiskers and great bulk. Adult Pacific males can weigh up to 1,700 kilograms (3,700 lb) and, among pinnipeds, are exceeded in size only by the two species of elephant seals.[4] It resides primarily in shallow oceanic shelf habitat, spending a significant proportion of its life on sea ice in pursuit of its preferred diet of benthic bivalve mollusks. It is a relatively long-lived, social animal and is considered a keystone species in Arctic marine ecosystems. [TAB]The walrus has played a prominent role in the cultures of many indigenous Arctic peoples, who have hunted the walrus for its meat, fat, skin, tusks and bone. In the 19th and early 20th centuries, the walrus was the object of heavy commercial exploitation for blubber and ivory and its numbers declined rapidly. Its global population has since rebounded, though the Atlantic and Laptev populations remain fragmented and at historically depressed levels.

[TAB]Amber is the name for fossil resin or tree sap that is appreciated for its colour. It is used for the manufacture of ornamental objects and jewellery. Although not mineralized, it is sometimes considered a gemstone. Most of the world's amber is in the range of 30-90 million years old. Semi-fossilized resin or sub-fossil amber is called copal. The presence of insects in amber was noticed by the Romans and led them to the (correct) theory that at some point, amber had to be in a liquid state to cover the bodies of insects. Hence they gave it the expressive name of suceinum or gum-stone, a name that is still in use today to describe succinic acid as well as succinite, a term given to a particular type of amber by James Dwight Dana (see below under Baltic Amber). The Greek name for amber was Electron and was connected to the Sun God, one of whose titles was Elector or the Awakener.
